newsitem.title: JAPAN: ISS, Softbank to set up software marketing firm.
newsitem.headline: ISS, Softbank to set up software marketing firm.

text.p: Internet Security Systems KK, a unit of Internet Security Systems Inc of the United States, said on Wednesday that it plans set up a joint venture with Softbank Corp to sell software for computer network security in Japan.
A spokeswoman for the Japanese unit of ISS said the timing for setting up the joint venture had not yet been decided.
ISS's Japanese unit currently sells its products through several marketing partners including Softbank.
The Japanese unit, which was set up in February, is aiming for sales of 800 million yen in Japan and other parts of Asia in the period to December 31.
